title: [不定時update] 點睇達魂籌備緊ge game?

replies.msg:
TL;DR 打開雪櫃將所有隔夜飯餸炒埋一碟好難保證好食。
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
終於有時間可以睇返達魂個記者招待會。

入正題之前，先總結下由影片所提到達魂新game的構思。
(source: https://www.facebook.com/mtgamerhk/videos/1339333276174001/)

１。泛娛樂對戰電競遊戲。(i.e. 單一遊戲，多娛樂內容 )
多娛樂內容定義為不同藝人， 不同電影， 不同遊戲，不同牌子中的不同角色混戰。

２。遊戲玩法集主要為策略性技術性
但係記招條片冇實際講到隻ＧＡＭＥ點ＲＵＮ先體驗到「策略性技術性」(i.e. 只係講左人對人而唔係人對電腦＆冇自動戰鬥)，所以我係呢到暫且理解做＂用個腦先玩到＂ge game啦。

３。課金渠道
GASH點數儲值

４。對隻game的期望
A. 通過合作，從而提攜本地其他game
B. 植入式廣告 (e.g. 麥當奴V.S. 上校)

障礙
 單一內容遊戲熱潮退左，隻game就好難sustain到
 角色版權

係正式討論隻game dev.之前，首先參考下其他games成功的地方。
[1] puzzles and dragons

https://www.quora.com/Why-is-Puzzle-Dragons-mobile-game-so-popular

1. The monsters

... To keep their player audience content and interested, new monsters with unique skills are frequently being introduced … they give players a prior notice before release to capture and maintain the interest of their players and give them a chance to save on magic stones (premium currency) to summon them.

… the main difference between success and failure of the game relies on pleasing the players, and this can be easily observed by how easy and frequent it is to obtain the premium currency (magic stones). From my experienced with PAD, I noticed that GungHo is very generous with their magic stones.

2. The gameplay

… the idea is simple yet challenging. Popular games like Candy Crush utilize this puzzle feature to match combos based on the given parameters and objective of the level…
... This time limit can be adjusted depending on the monsters you have; some monsters are able to extend the match time which give the player more time to match combos. However, matching orbs are not as common as moving an orb up, down, left, and right; the player has full control of the board.... This creates a whole new sense of strategy as players are given an infinite period of time to think about how they want to progress through the dungeon. Basically, players can exit the app, browse another app, stare at the screen for hours (would not recommend), and the dungeon monsters will still be waiting for the player to make the first move.

3. The RNG Summons

… PAD will consistently give players magic stones through events and challenges so as various monster pools are rotated in and out, players can summon at a frequent rate so it doesn’t feel that PAD is a pay-to-win (P2W) game... About the summoning feature of the game, it is common that the summoning events feature awesome monsters but the player doesn’t get what they want. It is obvious that the rates to pull an epic monster are quite low, but this gives the sense of gambling while not hurting your wallet. Due to the nature of the game, there are a lot of monsters in these summoning events that generally help the player in one way rather than hinder progress … summoning copies of one monster can be a pretty good thing.

版權先係大問題 出名實貴 唔出名買黎都晒氣

一係就好似其他GAME咁畫D角色 神出黎

但又無左佢一開始個賣點

版權先係大問題 出名實貴 唔出名買黎都晒氣

一係就好似其他GAME咁畫D角色 神出黎

但又無左佢一開始個賣點

佢成個記招俾我的感覺只係想整個platform 出黎sell其他人D野
所以你話"出名實貴 唔出名買黎都晒氣" 我係好同意
同埋有冇人同我一樣, 每當個CM講完野, 就好想扭甩佢個頭?

[1] puzzles and dragons

http://forum.us.monster-strike.com/discussion/2896/why-is-puzzle-dragons-more-popular-in-the-usa-than-monster-strike

MS = Monster Strike, 怪物彈珠

“… PAD came to the US market first… “

“… the continuous advertisements PAD cycles through virtually every conceivable avenue…. the idea of advertising a product usually works best when potential consumers know how the product works…”

“… because PAD is popular and gets up-voted so it remains popular. Also, it sounds like it could be a casual game (it has the word "PUZZLE" in its title).
No one really wants to get sucked into an MMO-style game…
… not a competitive game, which makes it different. But that could be for better or for worse since most mobile games in the Americas and Europe are competitive and that co-op games still sound "MMO-ish" with terms like "build a party" and "assemble a team".”

“… I feel PAD is a simpler game, so it has a lower barrier to entry…”

“…Both (Monster Strike & PAD) have strong communities…”

“… The initial sale point of a mobile game to the average consumer is that it's there to kill some time, be simple to play, and bring a type of instant gratification (at least for first few days of playing). Also the other most important sales point of a mobile game is that it is extremely social focus (social media).

…They did something that removed a core aspect of what made MS a social mobile game. By removing the social media coop, the community was basically torn apart with a lot of people being unable to play with each other. The only ones who could were those who would meet up in person, or through incorrect methods. I don't know how damaging this was to the MS community overall, but I do recall that the MS Facebook page never got any bigger after that happened...”

[1] puzzles and dragons

所以綜合部份玩家ge意見，一隻成功ge apps要具備以下的元素

1. 內容要獨特，不定時更新黎保鮮
2. 容易上手
3. 定時獎勵玩家
4. 廣告，但前題係potential consumers know how the product works
5. non-competitive
6. 強大的game community (即係有話題)

當然呢D只係部份玩家的感覺，實際上個extent影響到幾大就真係唔知。

[2] Pokémon Go

https://www.quora.com/Why-is-Pok%C3%A9mon-GO-so-popular

“...Riley Patterson rightly points out that Go’s availability at zero cost on phones that people already own (as opposed to a $40 game for a console fewer people own) is important to its success; I view cost as a necessary, but not sufficient condition for Go’s huge success.

The most striking thing about the Pokémon universe is how pervasive Pokémon are in everyone’s daily lives... That experience is so core to Pokémon’s essence... no Pokémon game has been able to replicate it. ... There’s always been this nagging feeling of emptiness when you stop playing...

It expands beyond the console ... The whole point of Go is that Pokémon are a part of the real world…

The app itself has some glaring flaws. It’s unreliable, slow, and crash-prone. Fundamental gameplay mechanics like healing, battling, and grinding are completely and utterly broken. But none of that really matters (for now), because you’re finally, perhaps unbelievably, living in the Pokémon universe like you never have before. Pokémon Go is, frankly, a breakthrough.

...Pokémon Go may very well be the pivotal moment for its genre, and games like it may soon become the norm.”

“…First and foremost is the Pokemon brand…

Also, Pokemon GO encapsulates what it means to be a Pokemon trainer…

Another key point to Pokemon GO’s success is the platforms it’s available on. Pokemon GO is available for Android and iOS…so, there is potentially a massive audience.

Pokemon GO is currently free to download and play, although there are optional in-game purchases (e.g. more Pokeballs, items, etc.), and it’s extremely easy to get started - you do not even have to have any knowledge of Pokemon. This makes it accessible for everyone. There’s a side affect to this, which is that a number of people may be playing the game “to see what the hype is about”, but probably would not have played it if it weren’t for the massive amounts of media attention.

… media attention… It’s hard to look anywhere without seeing this game.

… people out everywhere playing it…

On the matter of augmented reality…”

“The “New Shiny” effect

When something is new and has an initial groundswell of popularity it tends to build something of a hype feedback loop that builds upon itself until it fizzles out...

It’s healthy

The running meme is that Pokemon Go managed to do in 24 hours what Michelle Obama could not manage over the course of 8 years: get people outside and active…”

[2] Pokémon Go
https://www.quora.com/Why-is-Pok%C3%A9mon-GO-so-popular

“1. The Background

…PGO basically borrows the technical aspects of Ingress but replaces it with a widely known storyline & recognized brand called Pokemon.

Which means, the game developer Niantic had plenty of experience before launching Pokemon GO making this hardly an overnight success. Besides that, Niantic seems to be a Google company, which might explain their expertise with geo location services…”

“…Pokemon franchise: The franchise turned 20 this year, and what could be a better gift(no, I want Ash to win Kalos League, that would be a better gift)…”

“Pokemon Go is attractive and engaging because it play on a primal instinct called scavenging, and it provides fulfillment of hat instinct in an appropriate environment—outdoors….”

“it can be summarized in 3 Words:
Google: Google team made the app, so you would expect it’s a top notch experience.

Also wouldn’t be surprised if Google was involved in promoting it on google play store / youtube etc..

Nintendo: Have a huge following of gamers, ready to jump on the next bandwagon.

Pokemon: there was a craze about pokemon, kindof like the angrybird craze a couple years ago.”

“…My secondary research showed that the app encourages users’ physical and emotional activities in a positive way (Tong, Gupta, Lo, Choo, Gromala, & Shaw, 2017). The mobile augmented reality systems increases physical activities to all genders and ages (Althoff, White, & Horvitz, 2016; Howe, Suharlim, Ueda, Howe, Kawachi, & Rimm, 2016). My primary research finding included Pokémon Go users made the app to be family and friends activities; incorporated the app to their everyday life; made new friends; and kept them companies. The app seemed to have a potential to enhance socialization as well as provide companionship to its users.”

[2] Pokémon Go

https://www.mobify.com/insights/pokemon-go-popular/

“4. Compulsion Loops

Pokemon Go’s compulsion loop is simple:

Collect stuff to catch Pokemon
Collect Pokemon
Level Pokemon

Brands like Starbucks have used gamification tactics to drive customer loyalty. Users of Starbucks’ My Rewards accumulate points every time they purchase, but it doesn’t stop there. The program also has 3 levels based on the degree of loyalty, with more personalized rewards the higher you go in order to keep customers engaged.

5. Neurological Reward Systems

Video games are known for producing mood boosting chemicals (called endorphins) as a reward for a mainly motionless task. …”

[2] Pokémon Go

所以綜合部份ge意見，Pokémon Go 成功可以係

1. 唔駛課金都玩到
2. Pokémon Go 個朵本身響 (本身個player base夠大)
3. reward system & Compulsion loop
4. 傳媒焦點
5. Augmented Reality
6. 童年回憶
7. 擴闊社交圈子
8. 增強健康
9. 夠潮 (見The “New Shiny” effect)
